website_summaries.verdict: An affordable gun case with a lot of functionality and the ability to lock with a padlock.
pros: Comes in four different material choices
Includes a double zipper for locking
Nice placement on the shoulder strap
Thick enough to fit a gun with scope
Equal in quality to much more expensive cases
cons: There is nothing discrete about this gun case
It definitely looks like a gun case

customer_reviews.title: 42" case perfect for 18" barrel AR-15 with scope on raised mount
customer_reviews.text: I bought this case for my AR-15 with a scope mounted on a riser mount. The rifle fits perfectly, with a little room to spare in all dimensions. The pockets on the side are perfect for the mags. It feels like a good quality build, though not super tough like a fire hose. It has just enough padding to protect from normal bumping and moving. It's just what I wanted to take my AR from its safe storage place at my home to the range and back. If you plan to carry it through the jungle on the back of a donkey, you should look for a more durable case. Great value, good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Praedo

customer_reviews.title: Wrong size
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a case that had a minimum dimension. This case was either measured wrong, since it was over 1 inch shorter in length and height from the stated description. Or I was sent the wrong case. Otherwise, this was a very well built case with nice features. Unfortunately, it was too short in length and height for my item to fit inside. I found another case that was better suited for my item. (Savior Equipment The Patriot Single Scoped Long Rifle Case Gun Bag w/Padded Handle - Adjustable Sling, Dual Lockable Zippers, Multiple Magazine Holder Pouch, Available Length in 35" 41" 45")  with the 41 inch interior length being just right.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.

customer_reviews.title: 5.5 inches SMALLER than posted dimension
customer_reviews.text: nice looking bag. has good straps appears sturdy. WRONG DIMENSIONS. "Product details Size: 40"L x 13"H | Color: Tan Product Dimensions: 3 x 14 x 45 inches" Nothing on this bag is 45" or even 40" outside. Actual measured size is 39.5x12 Also-pockets are good size BUT the flap that covers them is one single large hard to open flap and doesnt come down and cover the pockets all teh way. I wish this had a zipper pocket like others have. Had to return it since no dimension on it was as described.
customer_reviews.author: ccpanel

customer_reviews.title: Bought  2 of these and LOVE it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these over a few months (the smallest size) for my AR's with 16" barrels, scope and sling with collapsible stock and fits perfectly. Very sturdy with lots of padding and thick heavy duty zippers. Overall it's built with quality material that will protect what you put inside.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Good case
customer_reviews.text: My AR carbine fits into this perfectly. I have a 16” carbine with an A2 flash hider on it. It has a little spare space but not much. If you have a very long muzzle device or a can that you leave attached then this will not be for you. The dimensions are pretty true to the advertised description. I have had the rifle out in it a few times so far. No holes have sprung open in the stitching, no zipper failures, the rifle hasn’t bored it’s way through the case in any locations yet. I would say this thing is pretty solid so far.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M

customer_reviews.title: Works fine for my two rifles
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made and sturdy case. I only use it when transporting my two rifles, and ordered the 42" length so that my old Marlin Glenfield model 60 would also fit. I also have a High Point 995TS carbine, and I separate the two with a piece of padding cut to fit. The pockets each swallow my 50 round boxes of 9 MM ammo as shown in the picture, or a couple of boxes of 100 round 22LR ammo, and a speedloader for the 9MM.
customer_reviews.author: J. Haggerty

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Two weeks into use of the bag one of the strap clips broke. I replaced the strap and three weeks later the stitching on the strap loop, connected to the case, gave out. This case is of inferior quality. Going back to Blackhawk for a quality bag.
customer_reviews.author: Denised1975

customer_reviews.title: Excellent soft case with thick padding and external puches...
customer_reviews.text: I was actually looking for hard case. Ordered a cheapo Plano 34 inch case which was supposed to have 4 latches but came two missing, replacement had the same issue. I decided to try this soft case.. iIwas particularly aiming for 34 inches to shorten the space.. it worked like a charm.. Pros: - 34 inches is a good size if you do not have a scope - padding is very think, you do not actually need velcros - 5 external pouches that fit 30 rnd are awesome - price is crazy..less than $30 for this case is a steal I highly recommend this case... Buy it..
customer_reviews.author: Hans Blix (Pol)

customer_reviews.title: LENGTH IS NOT TRUE TO SIZE
customer_reviews.text: Just received this case today. Case is well made and padded. Nice features, extra magazine pouches, adjustable shoulder strap, adequate depth top to bottom, easy to lock and carry. No real complaints. I would have given 5 stars BUT IT IS NOT TRUE TO SIZE. I ordered the 38" model but it was in reality only 36" long INSIDE. I would recommend this case ONLY please order the next size up in length!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: TRY IT YOU WILL LIKE IT
customer_reviews.text: I brought this case for a Hi-Point 9mm carbine mounting an NC Star Tri Rail scope. I figured a cheap case for a relatively inexpensive gun. Was I surprised when this case arrived. The construction, padding and fit rivaled my more expensive cases. I now have a new favorite gun case. The material used in the case construction seems to of good quality and designed to stand up to abuse. the velcro flap covering the magazine pouches has sufficient purchase to keep the magazines from falling out when carrying the case. All in all, this case would probably meet the standards of most people. The case is inexpensive, not cheap.
customer_reviews.author: 65gone

customer_reviews.title: Great Weapons Case
customer_reviews.text: Shipped quickly! Great quality and ACU pattern! Works great for full length AR 15s, either Retros like Brownell manufactures or current and modern versions of the same weapons system! Thank you NC Star for such a high quality case! Thank you Amazon for shipping such an essential item so quickly to protect my tool for defending my family and country in such trying times of anarchy and chaos orchestrated by the socialist left!
customer_reviews.author: Ricky D. Leonard

customer_reviews.title: Best gun case for the money
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these and bought one for my son also. The only thing I don't like about them is the Velcro on the magazine pockets. When you pull that open to get a new magazine I'm sure it can be heard for miles. I'm going to see if my daughter can take it off and replace it with snaps. The rest of this case is excellent, I've had no trouble with snags on the inside, the outside is durable and cleans easily, and the zipper is heavy duty and works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: SmartAleck73

customer_reviews.title: Fine Case For the Money
customer_reviews.text: I just received this case so I cannot speak to its durability, but I expect it to perform well. It is sufficiently padded, and my AR-15 fit in it just fine with the stock collapsed. The mag pouches hold mags just fine. For the money, I'm very satisfied. Update: I just discovered that this case also fits my Hi Point 995 carbine well. I may have to buy a second one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Dan in SE Tennessee

customer_reviews.title: Great basic rifle bag.
customer_reviews.text: For an AR-15 with a 16" barrel and retracting stock, the 38" bag was a good choice. I think it would fit in the 36" but would definitely need the stock fully retracted, and the bag would be snug on the muzzle device. It feels durable, the padding is quality, and the mag pouches each hold a full magazine no problem, but 2 in one spot don't quite fit.
customer_reviews.author: Chris C.

customer_reviews.title: Best bag for the price range
customer_reviews.text: Based on the price, this bag is worth the money. If you are planning on using it for a ar with a quad-rail, try to find someone who has the bag to test it out. My 15" keymod handguard fits really snug in this bag especially with all the mag slots filled so i'm assuming space may be an issue with a handguard more bulky. Other than that i am happy with the purchase and it was a perfect replacement for an old bag.
customer_reviews.author: S.H.

customer_reviews.title: Quality is equal to other brands I own but less money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bag to fit my Thompson center pro hunter as my other cases weren’t long enough they handle the 26 inch barrel that it has. Other bags for more money didn’t seem to be padded as well as this one. I use the magazine pouches to put my ammo boxes in, Remington boxes fit right in. I’m leaning toward buying a few more for some other rifles.
customer_reviews.author: 38Super

customer_reviews.title: My 2nd one - they're great
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these for a 16" barrel rifle with collapsible stock a couple years ago. They work great, hold up well, and the side pockets are perfect for extra mags, tools, attachments, etc. I just built a new 20" barrel rifle with A2 stock and of course I bought this same case for that gun (longer length). It arrived on time and well packaged, so another winner here.
customer_reviews.author: superbeau

customer_reviews.title: breaking straps and corroding barrel
customer_reviews.text: Both clips on the strap broke off. Had to repair with wire ties. Something in the liner is causing spots of corrosion on my barrel. If I were to hazard a guess, the poly material has some sort of chemical in it. I clean and oil my gun after every weekly use and have never seen something like this before. would return it in a heartbeat if I wasn't outside the Amazon return window. Not happy at all.
customer_reviews.author: A. B.

customer_reviews.title: Bad material, no offer to fix from the company. Go with a more trusted brand
customer_reviews.text: I use this rifle bag for standard, normal use, standard rifle and ammo weight. By the second week the metal clip of the strap broke. I fixed it and the other metal strap broke a short while after. A month into using the bag the entire shoulder strap came off the bag due to bad stitching.... No warranty from the company to fix this issue.... I do not recommend to buy. Better, more trusted brands out there!
customer_reviews.author: Leilani1603

customer_reviews.title: Good soft case
customer_reviews.text: Zips up nice and tight, inside material is soft non abrasive, outside pouches are fairly large I can almost fit 2 mags per pouch, strong Velcro. Outside material is durable, carrying straps are great. Overall for a soft case it’s worth the money for me. Only giving it 4 stars because I would like a Velcro strap on the inside to secure my weapon from moving around (it doesn’t move much though, but I wouldn’t zero my optic then expect it to be zero’d again after being in the case).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend a 42" version if you plan on using a ...
customer_reviews.text: Just got this product so I can't comment on it's reliability, but it appears very well made. I bought a 40" long one and it fits my S&W Sport 2 with retracted stock and 16" barrel perfectly. With stock extended there's maybe 3" to spare overall. I would recommend a 42" version if you plan on using a longer barrel or a fixed stock. Also, the front magazine pockets are a bit tight for a 30 rd AR-15 PMAG. Perfectly usable, though. But they would most likely not work for a curved AK mag. For just over $20 this is a very good case.
customer_reviews.author: Ummagumma

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 of these now. First one was plush and soft on the inside, well sewed with rugged material on the outside, and I like how I can buy different sizes and colors; so I kept buying more from the same seller as I got more AR's. All the other haven't disappointed either.
customer_reviews.author: R. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Fits my AR just fine
customer_reviews.text: For the price its a nice case. I have a high riser with my red dot and bipod attached to handguard and it fits nice and snug but not too tight. It fits 5 30 rd mags but I do wish the flaps were individual. Just clumsy to have a long flap to open up. Material is nice and stitching is good. The clasp for the top shoulder sling did bust the first day I used it but I bent the clasp with a pair of pliers and its held up well since.
customer_reviews.author: John  WA

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I don't think it will stand the test of time nor is of the same quality class as an Ace Case, however those are twice as expensive. But, as always, you get what you pay for. I was going to order another Ace Case, but the shipping price from Ace was prohibitively expensive for a small order, so I'll wait on that. Seems like quality construction. The zippers appear to be of decent quality and padding is sufficient. No grade on durability as I just bought it. For the price of around $20, 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Adam H

customer_reviews.title: Not designed for 30 round AK magazines
customer_reviews.text: This case seems to be pretty well made however, the magazine pouches aren't deep enough to fit a 30 round AK magazine and pull the cover flap to secure them with the provided velcro closures attached, it would probably fit a 20 round magazine or possibly an AR straight magazine, I will be looking at others that will fit my mags, wish I would have known this prior to purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Unbiased Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: This is not a true 40" case
customer_reviews.text: Just received the case for use with an AR-10 with an 18" barrel and a Nikon scope. Unfortunately, this is a 39" long case and not a true 40". We got a measuring tape and measured the spine of the case to confirm. My rifle is 38" but since it has some depth to it, it eats up that extra inch of length and creates a very, very tight fit. We had to remove the bipod and store it separately just to make it fit. Buyer beware. If your rifle specs resemble mine, order a larger size from this manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: AngryBadger

customer_reviews.title: More than expected!
customer_reviews.text: For the price, I was just hoping it would zip up and provide some protection. Was pleasantly surprised to discover this case is well padded, well constructed and has a strong zipper. Expect this will provide safe transport to and from the range for many years.
customer_reviews.author: wander_indiana

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value in an AR case
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to spend several times the cost of this case. I holds my S&W M&P 15 with a compact scope easily. The zipper quality is excellent and it has an ample number of magazine pouches. There is room in the case to hold a few additional accessories.
customer_reviews.author: Richard L. Weatherly

customer_reviews.title: Fits Full Sized Airsoft Gun + Long Range Scope
customer_reviews.text: I bought this expecting it to not be that great but I just needed something to put my airsoft M4 in. It's surprisingly good quality and the only problem I have is the small pockets on the side not having big enough flaps to pack more items in the pockets.
customer_reviews.author: EliteReviewsUSA

customer_reviews.title: VISM by NcStar Gun Case 36" and 40"
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a 36" case for an AR build and it was a useable 33.5" on the interior. Sent it back and ordered the 40" and it is a good fit for the rifle, 18" barrel with a 16x scope. Just about 1" to spare with the stock extended at the sweet spot. So they may run a tad on the small size on the interior. The case itself has good solid zippers, good heavy cordura and stout construction throughout. Well worth the price of admission.5 stars
customer_reviews.author: R. Morton

customer_reviews.title: The case is good but the company is great.
customer_reviews.text: I had a problem with the zipper on the original case I received but the company that supplied the case went over and above replacing the case. The zipper problem was probably my fault because I bought the smallest bag I thought I could use but didn't take into account the folding stock would put more stress on the zipper. They replaced the case with an even bigger case at no additional charge. That is customer service at it's best as far as I'm concerned. The companies name is Extreme-Tronics and I will no doubt use them again in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas R Suttle Jr

customer_reviews.title: Nice case
customer_reviews.text: Mine is about 18 months old now and has held up very well to several trips to the range..The padding is a little thin, but it's sufficient with reasonable handling. The zipper slides smoothly and is large enough to grasp with gloves on. The velcro holds very well.The mag pouches are properly sized and hold onto the mags well...I plan on getting a few more.
customer_reviews.author: PawPaw

customer_reviews.title: Fit great for an AR with a 18" barrel
customer_reviews.text: Case was as expected! Great for the price. Only flaw is that it is one flap for the pockets, would be nice if it was separated but otherwise I am very happy with the case! Seems very sturdy and padded nicely. Will protect your boom stick very well.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Carry Bag
customer_reviews.text: Great carry bag. Love the large pockets. I use four for carrying mags, and one for gun oil rifle rod, patches and screwdrivers. My AR fits perfectly, and I love the padding protecting the rifle. Also love the water resistant material.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Kaiser

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: This was a very good buy. Feels like it has a solid build quality. And the storage is just what I need when going to the range. I like to pre-load, so when I go in, I don't have to load up magazines. Being able to walk in with 5X30 is great for a quick hour run.
customer_reviews.author: S. Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Hey Nice case I like it
customer_reviews.text: fit an AR-15 no problem . 30 RD. mags fit in pouch. I used the strap on it. It may not have the best place for the attachment points to be put but it works just fine and comfortable to carry that way. And yes individually Velcro cover for each mag pouch instead just one big one would have been nice but I am sure the price would jump way up. I am very happy with the purchase . Give it a good spray of water repellent. Had it out in some pretty heavy rain and it did pick up moisture and had to be dried out.
customer_reviews.author: Stillonit

customer_reviews.title: Great case for the price, would absolutely buy again
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this rifle case, especially for this price point. I bought it to store and carry my S&W M&P15 II, which fits perfectly with the stock collapsed in all the way. I don't have a scope or red-dot fitted though so I can't say how the fit would be regarding that. Shoulder strap works just fine, carrying handle works just fine. Only thing holding me back from giving 5 stars is that personally I would like the Velcro on the magazine pouches to be individualized to each pouch, rather than one catch-all flap that covers all 5 pouches. That being said, I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this to any AR15 owner looking for a low-cost case.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good bag for the money
customer_reviews.text: Pros: + Decent quality + Will fit 5 30 round magazines + Lighter than a hard case + Has a shoulder strap Cons: - Its pretty bendy - but it is a bag. Make sure you do not get one that is too big for your rifle - Nope that is it... it is bendy. It is a bag. Not really anything else to complain about. And a bendy bag is not a valid complaint.
customer_reviews.author: jameshspencerjr

customer_reviews.title: Great case
customer_reviews.text: These VISM gun cases are really excellent. This is the third one I've bought, and haven't had a thing wrong with any of them, so I don't see the need to pay more. I'm using this cases for a 20" AR w/carbine fixed stock and it fits fine.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great soft case for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to hold a rifle I built for my dad. Both he and I were impressed with the quality of the case. I got this because I didn't want to drop another 60-100 on a hard case after building the gift rifle. I will probably pick up another one or two of these for myself. Good quality. Beefy zipper. Plenty of storage for mags and ammo.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny M

customer_reviews.title: Get one
customer_reviews.text: I agree with the other five star ratings. Excellent case for a very nice price. Well padded and great quality for a reasonable price. Fits my S&W M&P Sport 2 perfectly for a trip to the range. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Nice case, good value.
customer_reviews.text: Does what it is supposed to do. Great value for the money. I appreciate the mag pockets in the side. Love the OD green color. I’m cheap and would rather put money into my rifle than a Gucci rifle case. This does the job and looks good.
customer_reviews.author: S. Warkocki

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality for a low price
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised with the quality of this bag. It was such a low price I wasn't expecting too much. I feel I got more than what I paid for. The zipper is #10, which is the super heavy duty one. This is great because you are least likely to deal with broken zippers. Gun bags with #8 sized zippers and below are lame, expect those to come apart eventually. Everything is double stitched, metal hardware for the sling, and it uses heavy duty nylon material for the exterior. The bag is simple, low priced, and good quality. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Flagnar

customer_reviews.title: Well-made, sized accurately
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Air Arms TX200 air rifle. It just BARELY fits. If you can find one, get a case an inch or two longer for that gun. The thing I liked about this case is that it is tall enough to accommodate a big scope with a big side focus wheel. But I tell you what, when they said 42", they mean it. There is NO extra room. I have the muzzle of the barrel rammed against the front zipper, and the butt pad against the back zipper when closing it up.
customer_reviews.author: Smaug

customer_reviews.title: Broken zipper after a year
customer_reviews.text: Im a police officer and after a year the zipper is broken. The case is not useable anymore. CHEAP DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Can't get enough of these NcSTAR VISM bags
customer_reviews.text: I own two of these bags now for two different carbines and would happily buy more. Great durability, storage, protection, and looks. I have gotten comments at the range on how nice the bags look.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Great carry bag, one tiny issue
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag, nicely padded inside, heavy duty zipper, nice snug fit for my rifle. My only gripe is that the magazine pouches is one big velcro pull, they are not individually covered.
customer_reviews.author: kenny

customer_reviews.title: 36 Inch Rifle Bag for my S&W 15-22
customer_reviews.text: This fits the bill for my S&W 15-22 which is a length of 32 inches with the stock collapsed. No extra room but at least it won't bounce around at all. Tied some zip ties though the zippers to open and close them with less effort.
customer_reviews.author: SteveB 89052

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these cuz the price is so good for the high quality you get. Perfect for my many AR builds. Protects one of my 4 figure ARs and optical accessories. I trust this bag. And it’s a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: kevin

customer_reviews.title: 36 Inches, sort of.
customer_reviews.text: This case is really nice for the price. My only complaint is NcStar missed the mark by 1 inch or so. That may not sound like a lot unless your rifle is 35 inches end to end and the case is 35 inches end to end but the zippers are 34 INCHES END TO END. You had one job, NcStar.
customer_reviews.author: Brian White

customer_reviews.title: Great case for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great case for the price. Gun fit like a glove. Seems to be well made and doesn't feel flimsy or cheap. Was very surprised at the weight of this case when I got it. I was worried that there are no straps to hold my rifle, but as long as you get the right size gun fits snug and no need for the straps. I bought this for my AR with a scope and it's such a nice case, I'm gonna order one for my AK next.
customer_reviews.author: loveGod

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality, but runs a little smaller than advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the 36 x 13 inch case. When it came, it was actually about 34.5 inches (usable inside length). It will work for my rifle, but really wanted a true 36 inch length. I noticed they also have a 38 x 13 case. I really do like the thickness, ruggedness and excellent quality, so I am going to order a 38 inch one and give this one to my nephew as a Christmas gift. Would have given 5 stars had it been true to size.
customer_reviews.author: Veloosh

customer_reviews.title: One of my best Amazon purchases
customer_reviews.text: Great quality! I was very impressed with this product. I use it for an M&P 15-22, holds 5 mags perfectly, plenty of length for the rifle, and could easily accommodate with an optic attached. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Could have been great if I could have fit it in.
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a nice case, but it will not fit an AR-15 as advertised. I have a M4A3, with a 16" barrel and collapsed telescoping stock and could not get it to fit. Too bad, because it really looked like a nice quality case. I have since returned this case.
customer_reviews.author: Woodnv

customer_reviews.title: 40 inch is good size for most sporting rifles
customer_reviews.text: I have a couple of these and they work well for general range use. The 40 inch seems to fit most sporting rifles, including AK type and AR-15 styles. I probably wouldn't go any smaller although you might be able to. I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Lily&Engineer

customer_reviews.title: For the money take a chance.
customer_reviews.text: Fits my Ak pistol 10.5 inch barrel 30 inches oal with sba4 brace like a glove and almost fits with 30 rd mag in gun but not quite.nice secure Velcro pockets but for small mags.One star for durability because that is unknown being new.
customer_reviews.author: lab2953

customer_reviews.title: Two Year Review:  It's Junk
customer_reviews.text: Don't you love reading reviews from people who never even use the product? They take it out of the box and immediately review it with a glowing 5 star "looks great!" review. Well I don't. This case has been used probably 26-30 times over the last two years since purchase. Within that time (going back and forth to the range), every. single. magazine pocket has ripped through a along the bottom seem resulting in mags dropping out the bottom. One zipper stopped working. The case itself is still relatively intact and works as a rifle case (sans magazine holders) so two stars it is. Pay more, get more. Or settle for crap. Learned my lesson and buying a Condor.
customer_reviews.author: Heisenberg

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Got the wrong size, but it looks good. I just wish those side poutches were a bit bigher so you could fit a box of ammo on them. Also wouldnt recomend putting a hot rifle in it.
customer_reviews.author: Einelson

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality! I can fit my Ruger 556 with a fore grip, flashlight, and laser on the rail system. I got the 36 inch case, and it fits snug with just enough room with the stock collapsed. I am confident I can add more to the rifle on the sides and have enough room to fit. I can also put magazines on the side, a great addition to any rifle case for the range. As a plus, it also comes with a sling to carry. Thanks a bunch!
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Not quite 36"
customer_reviews.text: on the inside. My ar with the butt stock collapsed is 32" oal and has just enough room in this case. Overall it's a very good case, well padded, and I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Jawjadawg1950

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Case!
customer_reviews.text: I love this case! The fit is perfect and the price was right. I didn't need a case that had space to store 500 different things in it along with the kitchen sink or a case that would break the bank. I was a little nervous due to the low price point but I'm so glad I went with this one. I'd buy this again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: A C

customer_reviews.title: Don't let the maker's name make you think its low quality
customer_reviews.text: The VISM gun case is really nice for the price.My scoped semi-auto battle rifle fits with room to spare. The pockets are also very convenient for the extra magazines. Not as well padded as I would have preferred, but for the price it was still well worth it.I'm glad I was able to purchase it for such a good price. I plan to buy another. When I read the name of the company that it was from I thought it would be low quality, but I was surprised that it was this good. One of the best deals I got on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Johnnyjaguar

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Arrived today. I bought the 40" and my DDM4V11 fits perfectly. Even though the ADM mount for the Vortex Strikefire will relocate spot-on, I prefer to leave it on the rifle so this size case is exactly what I wanted. Quality seems excellent, the padding is ample. I'm a happy camper.
customer_reviews.author: C J

customer_reviews.title: THIS HAS TO BE A "BEST BUY"!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing heavy-duty quality materials and construction, especially given the low cost. The case is very well padded, with dual heavy-duty zippers, and will provide excellent protection. Super comfortable carrying handle and lots of ammo and gear room in the multiple outside pockets. I bought the case for a Ruger 10/22 (18.5" barrel) that is equipped with a Nikon Prostaff Rimfire 4 x 32 scope (mounted with Weaver medium rings). The rifle fits nicely in the case, with about 3" to spare on the length and 4" to spare on the height. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS CASE! Photo added on 6 AUG 15.
customer_reviews.author: NC BILL

customer_reviews.title: By the right size
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend buying the 42 inch verse 38 inch for a AK rifle. The 38” fit perfectly but after I added bipod and other attachments it did not fit had to return it and get the 42 inch other than that looks great
customer_reviews.author: jan

customer_reviews.title: Great AR case
customer_reviews.text: Great Case! Fits my 34" AR (with buttstock in) 16" barrel mid-length with scope just perfect. Padded well. Seems to be of quality build - zipper works great etc... plenty of room in mag pockets for mags or other items you may want to tote to range. I would definitely buy again. Top carry handle has Velcro to hold both together. It does have a shoulder strap? But it is on the bottom - not sure why or how I would use it.
customer_reviews.author: Larry D.

customer_reviews.title: The bang for buck on this is outstanding!
customer_reviews.text: The bang for buck on this is outstanding! For the price, I figured it would be similar to one I bought a few years ago for my S&W M&P15-22, which was merely adequate. Things have started to fail on that one, like the snap for the cheesy leather-like handle closure. I don't see this happening on this one for its big brother, the S&W M&P-15 in 5.56mm NATO. Just robust throughout, metal clasps on the strap, high denier count on handle closure, which is hook and loop, high-quality interior, and room for more mags than I own on the outside. Just a much higher quality soft case than I was prepared for.
customer_reviews.author: -=Spectre=-

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: I don't lock mine and never tested that feature. Use it for AR and AK although 30 round AK mags barely fit. 20 rounders are great. Solid quality products.
customer_reviews.author: Huntsman69

customer_reviews.title: For the price - it's GREAT
customer_reviews.text: Solidly put together. It is just big enough to fit a Carbine length AR (16" barrel w/6 position telescoping stock - fully extended). There are 5 Magazine pouches and you can actually fit 2 magazines per pouch with a little persuasion. The only drawback is that the magazine pouches are not individually covered, meaning you can't access one at a time. There is one big cover that closes over all the magazine pouches and you have to open the whole thing to get access to one mag. But for the price, I can live with that.
customer_reviews.author: J. W. Gallacher

customer_reviews.title: More Bang for the Buck$
customer_reviews.text: Nice case; for the price, could find few shortcomings. The 36"X 13" has 5 mag pockets covered by single full length velcro closure. Double Zipper has no holes for a luggage lock. Carry handle is a continuous wrap around the case. Covered foam padding roughly 1" thick on sides. Shoulder strap appears securely attached. This case fit a standard 16" bbl CAR15, standard A2 flash-hider, stock fully collapsed with an inch to spare internal length. What's great is the price for such a quality case. Should hold up well for protecting weapon as long as one doesn't drag it behind their trucks. It's NOT a drop or drag bag.
customer_reviews.author: tatersaladgang

customer_reviews.title: great LF rifle bag!
customer_reviews.text: i got this bag to match my FDE AR15. great price. saved me $5 from other sellers. quality feels great and holds up just like my black hawk ar15 bag.
customer_reviews.author: AdamWorkingHard

customer_reviews.title: Great range case
customer_reviews.text: Got this case for an mPAP-70 (ak-47 variant) and the rifle itself fits perfectly. The magazine pouches were designed for the ar-15 platform so my mags won't allow the flap to fully close over the to of them. Otherwise I love this case
customer_reviews.author: Jadi Checketts

customer_reviews.title: If you have to buy a Chinese product, you might as well get this.
customer_reviews.text: Lets make this as simple as possible. The case is solid, the seams are well sown. As long as you pay attention to what length you need, this fits the bill perfectly! I am not particular on the color of the bag, it's not like I am taking it to Afghanistan, I just use it in Texas.....LOL It fits my wapon well, holds the extra mags and does what I need. Why pay 100.00? It's 25.00. So save on the bag, and use the money on ammo! Too bad we can get bags like this, at this prce point, made in USA,
customer_reviews.author: Hi Def Watcher

customer_reviews.title: Nice simple gun case
customer_reviews.text: Good quality for the price. Was happy till I replace the wood stock for my AKM. The stock adapter ended up adding the 1" in that made it stick out of the case (no ones fault but my own). The only downside is the sling that it comes with. Had to bend the metal clips back a few times because it couldn't stand up to the weight .
customer_reviews.author: Jayce

customer_reviews.title: Strap broke from one use carrying the gun to the range.
customer_reviews.text: Strap broke the first time i used it sending my gun crashing to the ground. The case seems pretty decent otherwise maybe i just got a defective one but it is a bit frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: MAdelines Dad

customer_reviews.title: barely fit my rifle-
customer_reviews.text: been using this bag for a while now & after placing a scope on my standard rifle it no longer fits comfortably in this bag. do yourself a favor & purchase a larger bag- unfortunately i did not.
customer_reviews.author: Leif K.

customer_reviews.title: Great for an AR
customer_reviews.text: With my stock fully collapsed it holds my AR with a scope mounted on it. I also keep a Sig Sauer 1911 in one of the front pockets as well as an extra 30 round mag. The Velcro on the front pocket is very durable feeling just like the entire case. Already have and do recommend this product. Happy Hunting :)
customer_reviews.author: JarrodH

customer_reviews.title: Well Made, should last forever! Plenty of room.
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased! Very durable material and well constructed. Glad I bought it, a good value. Has plenty of room, even with scope and bi-pod mounted. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: CrankyOldFart

customer_reviews.title: just got it for daughter who is a police officer and it seems good quality and craftsmanship
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used it , just got it for daughter who is a police officer and it seems good quality and craftsmanship. It is not designed to be ahard case so for what its designed it appears excellent. Velcro is 2" wide which is very secure. Zipper is heavy duty and appears durable. It has a thick 2 handle carry or long shoulder strap carry. An excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Killingbrck

customer_reviews.title: COOL CASE
customer_reviews.text: THIS WAS FOR MY COMPOUND BOW BUT DID NOT FIT... BUT VERY PADDED CASE WORTH THE MONEY STILL GIVE IT 5 STARS HAD TO RETURN IT...
customer_reviews.author: john baccarella

customer_reviews.title: Fits Hi point 45 carbine really well and puppy approved
customer_reviews.text: Case seems to be good quality and has enough padding to protect a gun from low drops. The pockets holds 9mm ammo in plastic trays for my hand guns along with 45 mags. Not crazy about the shoulder strap and probably never use, but really like the hand straps. Fits my 45 carbine really well.
customer_reviews.author: Rattpac

customer_reviews.title: Decent value case
customer_reviews.text: Not really meant as a lockable case, no soft case is. Good for airsoft or getting your MSR to the range. No accessory pouch.
customer_reviews.author: R. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great Gun Case - Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: This case is a great choice for full sized rifles, providing good protection at a reasonable price. The case is large enough for AR-15s (16" barrel with collapsible stock) and AK-47s, fitting either with room to spare. This is well made with good quality materials, strong zippers, and is nicely padded without being too bulky. There are five large magazine pockets on the side that can hold 30rd AR or AK mags and are covered with a large Velcro secured flap but would have preferred individual covers. The case also has good carrying handles and a shoulder strap. This is a real value for what you get! Highly Recommended! CFH
customer_reviews.author: C. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value
customer_reviews.text: Case is just as described, Fits the AK with a large scope and the outside pockets easily accommodate mags. Good value and I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Moudry

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Great bag. Very strong fabric. Stitch work is great. heavy duty zippers. Inside of the bag has nice foam padding. Holds my AR perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew J.

customer_reviews.title: Not really made for AK-47's
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these. My AR-15 & magazines fit perfectly. My Serbian AK-47 will fit in the case but the AK magazines are too long for the mag. pockets on the side. I bought the 40" for the AK-47 and wish that I had bought the 42" version.
customer_reviews.author: C. R. Hulen

customer_reviews.title: Shorter than stated length
customer_reviews.text: Is much shorter than stated. I ordered a 36" case and this measures only 34.5" long. I would give it a higher rating if I got the correct length or heard back from the seller.
customer_reviews.author: Logan5

customer_reviews.title: Awesome case
customer_reviews.text: This case is super good quality! I can't believe it is such a great case for a small price!!! Definitely recommend it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tawna

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Bag
customer_reviews.text: I bought this insanely affordable bag for my ar-pistol but it actually fits my full sized 16” as well so I plan on buying a second one. Not sure why it was so inexpensive because the quality of the padding, the Velcro and especially the zippers are top notch!!! I love the green and the shoulder strap as well!! Coolest part is that the compartments on the front even hold .308 magazines as well, there are many products out there and it’s a bit overwhelming but I highly recommend this one
customer_reviews.author: Elliot

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Great case at a very reasonable price. I bought it for my Savage AR-15 and it fits perfectly. I also like the pouches in the front to hold spare magazines, tools, etc. I liked it enough to buy another one for my S&W AR15-22. It's built well and made of quality materials. If I need another, this is what I will buy.
customer_reviews.author: PhilaPop

customer_reviews.title: Excellent case for an AR15
customer_reviews.text: To put it simply, I'm very pleased with this case! It is extremely well made with wrap around carry handles that support the case from underneath, heavy duty zipper, thick padding and a nice soft lining. My Ruger AR556 fits perfectly with the stock collapsed and is very secure and doesn't move around when carrying. The five pouches hold 30 round magazines securely with strong and wide Velcro. The bottom line is this is a great case for your AR15.
customer_reviews.author: Jason's Pap

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for AR-15
customer_reviews.text: I have a Panther Oracle AR-15. With my stock collapsed the rifle fits perfectly. I also have a combo scope and it handled it no problem. Love this bag, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Right Size
customer_reviews.text: The main thing about these cases is getting the right size. Most will be made of tough materials and this is no different. Just to give people an idea of sizing I have an M&P 15T with a light at the right quad rail, a UTG bipod at the front lower rail and a short fore grip. I replaced my stock with a magpul ACS which I think does not change the overall length as much but is much thicker. My gun from the factory is 32 inches collapsed but the 36 inch case just barely fits my AR with all the accessories. Hope this helps in your selection.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: Great choice for a carbine length rifle
customer_reviews.text: Great choice for a carbine length rifle. Four stars because of the long strap- the hardware on the strap isn't stout and the positioning makes slinging the case awkward.Good padding thickness for most users,good zipper and good pockets for magazines.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel F. Dennin

customer_reviews.title: It pretty well met all of my expectations as I had ...
customer_reviews.text: It pretty well met all of my expectations as I had read others reviews. Plus: price was good, seems to be well made, fits my Ruger AR 556 w/ tactical scope on a riser really well, like the carry handles, good zipper, good exterior & good padding. Neg: like some others mentioned, don't care for one flap covering all mag pockets & sling attached to the fold which would have your rifle upside down & pressing on your optics. (But I have yet to use the sling; only the carry handles)
customer_reviews.author: O M

customer_reviews.title: Good case. Just very snug on my mini 14
customer_reviews.text: Good case. Just very snug on my mini 14. Kinda hard to get in sometimes. It sticks out on the zipper. I think I got the smallest size so I suggest yo get a size bigger
customer_reviews.author: Gaston Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Reasonably priced and adequate for medium or light use
customer_reviews.text: Nicely padded. Shoulder strap clip broke after hanging on a rack with a gun inside for a couple months. It was easily repaired by some better clips from the hardware store. Therefore, I don't recommend it for anything heavy. Several other VISM and NcStar products I own are similarly easy on the budget but not tough enough for duty level use. As is often the case, you get what you pay for, if you're lucky.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Ostman

customer_reviews.title: Nice little case for carrying gun to range
customer_reviews.text: Nice little case for carrying gun to range. I utilize for 9mm carbine. Case is approximately 1" longer than carbine. Mag pouches hold 2 9mm magazines side by side or narrow box of 9mm ammo (Tulammo packaging). Nice feature is that case zippers can be locked with a luggage lock to help secure from child access if you don't have ability to lock your gun up in lock box.
customer_reviews.author: James W.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Fit - and slim!
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfectly with my POF Wonder (32" collapsed) - I like it because its slim, easy to carry, and fits extra magazines!
customer_reviews.author: SonyaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: VISM by NcStar Gun Case (CVG2907-36), Green, 36"
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality. Fits my Kel-Tec RFB like a glove. Strong construction, mag pouches work great. I added a shoulder pad. The velcro is very strong and stays in place even after washing. Extra h/d padding that washed up well and stayed solid. To get the 'distressed look' I have washed it a dozenor so times on heavy duty / hot wash with Oxyclean and took a wire brush to scuff it up some and a touch of shoe polish to add some stain on the corners. Looks like my old kit. Just need to have my service patches stiched on and we are good to go. Nice job NcStar !
customer_reviews.author: M. William Atkinson

product_meta.title: NcSTAR VISM Deluxe Padded Rifle Case with External Magazine Pockets
feature_bullets: Constructed of Tough PVC Material, High density foam inner padding for superior protection.
Measurements provided are the outside overall length and height of the gun case.
NcSTAR recommends a case that is at least +2" longer than the firearm's overall length, for a proper fit.
Heavy duty Double Zippers, Full range of sizes to fit almost any rifle or shotgun. Measurements provided are the outside overall length and height of the gun case.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
